content:
Diagnosis:

Gallbladder squamous cell carcinoma, T3N2M1 with peritoneal and liver metastases

Previous treatment:
Cycle 1-3 Gemcitabine/Cisplatin March-May 2024
Palliative ascitic drain 15 May 2024

Molecular profile:
p53 mutation positive
Microsatellite stable (MSS)

Current medications:
Oxycodone MR 40mg BD
Pregabalin 75mg BD
Dexamethasone 4mg OD
Aprepitant PRN

Current situation:
Progressive disease on imaging
Worsening ascites and pain
PS 2-3

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has unfortunately shown clear evidence of disease progression. Recent CT performed on 1 June 2024 shows increase in peritoneal disease with new nodules, progression of liver metastases, and re-accumulation of ascites despite recent drainage. Her performance status has declined significantly over the past 3 weeks, now spending most of the day resting and requiring assistance with daily activities.

She describes worsening right upper quadrant and epigastric pain, partially controlled on current analgesia but requiring increasing breakthrough doses. Her appetite remains poor despite dexamethasone, with early satiety due to ascites. Weight has dropped by 4kg since last review.

Given her declining performance status and clear evidence of progression through first-line chemotherapy, we have had a detailed discussion about prognosis and future care options. While second-line treatment options exist, including FOLFOX chemotherapy, the likelihood of benefit must be weighed against potential toxicity. [redacted name] wishes to take time to consider her options.

I have increased her oxycodone to 60mg BD and arranged urgent referral to palliative care for symptom management support. We will review her again in one week to discuss treatment decisions. I have provided emergency contact details and arranged for port flush next week.
